From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Semer

Crimean Tatar

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Arabic ثَمَر (ṯamar).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Hyphenation: se‧mer

Noun

[edit]

semer

  1. fruit
    Synonyms: meyva, mahsul, netice, tuhum

Declension

[edit]
Declension of semer
singular plural
nominative semer semerler
genitive semerniñ semerlerniñ
dative semerge semerlerge
accusative semerni semerlerni
locative semerde semerlerde
ablative semerden semerlerden

References

[edit]
  • “semer”, in Luğatçıq (in Russian)

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old French semer, from Latin sēmināre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /sə.me/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Canada (Shawinigan)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

semer

  1. to sow (scatter seed, etc.)
  2. to shake off, to lose (a pursuer)
    • 2014, Édouard Louis, En finir avec Eddy Bellegueule [The End of Eddy], Le Seuil:
      […] il se relève tout de suite et avec ses collègues ils poursuivent Sylvain, la même chose que les courses-poursuites qu'on voit à la télé. Mais mon biloute, il se laisse pas faire, il arrive à semer la police. Ils le perdent.
      […] he gets up straight away and he and his colleagues chase Sylvain, like one of those chases you see on TV. But my mate, he doesn't give in, and he manages to shake off the police. They lose him.
  3. (figuratively) to spread, to sow
    semer la zizanie ― to sow dissent, to sow discord
    semer la pagaille ― to spread disorder, to wreak havoc
    semer la peur ― to fearmonger
    semer la terreur ― to spread terror
    semer la désolation ― (please add an English translation of this usage example)
    semer la mort ― (please add an English translation of this usage example)

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb is conjugated like parler, except the -e- /ə/ of the second-to-last syllable becomes -è- /ɛ/ when the next vowel is a silent or schwa -e-, as in the third-person singular present indicative il sème and the third-person singular future indicative il sèmera.

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.

past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

Derived terms

[edit]
  • qui sème le vent récolte la tempête

Derived terms

[edit]
  • semaison
  • semeur

[edit]

  • saison

  • semence
  • séminaire
  • séminal

Further reading

[edit]
  • “semer”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • mères

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin sēmināre.

Verb

[edit]

semer

  1. to sow (scatter seed, etc.)

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a first-group verb ending in -er. The forms that would normally end in *-ms, *-mt are modified to ns, nt. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of semer (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive semer avoir semé
gerund en semant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle semant
past participle semé
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present sem semes seme semons semez sement
imperfect semoie, semeie, semoe, semeve semoies, semeies, semoes, semeves semoit, semeit, semot, semeve semiiens, semiens semiiez, semiez semoient, semeient, semoent, semevent
preterite semai semas sema semames semastes semerent
future semerai semeras semera semerons semeroiz, semereiz, semerez semeront
conditional semeroie, semereie semeroies, semereies semeroit, semereit semeriiens, semeriens semeriiez, semeriez semeroient, semereient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
past anterior preterite tense of avoir + past participle
future perfect future tense of avoir + past participle
conditional perfect conditional tense of avoir + past participle
subjunctive que jo que tu qu’il que nos que vos qu’il
simple
tenses 		present sem sens sent semons semez sement
imperfect semasse semasses semast semissons, semissiens semissoiz, semissez, semissiez semassent

tenses 		past present subjunctive of avoir + past participle

Related terms

[edit]
  • semance

Descendants

[edit]
  • French: semer
  • Norman: s'maïr, s'mer

Turkish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Ottoman Turkish سمر (semer, “packsaddle”), from Greek σαμάρι (samári, “packsaddle”), diminutive of Ancient Greek σάγμα (ságma, “packsaddle”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [sɛmeɾ]
  • Hyphenation: se‧mer

Noun

[edit]

semer (definite accusative semeri, plural semerler)

  1. packsaddle
  2. (geology) anticline
  3. (biology) clitellum

Declension

[edit]
Declension of semer
singular plural
nominative semer semerler
definite accusative semeri semerleri
dative semere semerlere
locative semerde semerlerde
ablative semerden semerlerden
genitive semerin semerlerin
